thread.title: New polls: Clinton, Trump hold leads; Boehner receives poor rank
thread.title_full: New polls: Clinton, Trump hold leads; Boehner receives poor rank

title: New polls: Clinton, Trump hold leads; Boehner receives poor rank
text:
With the first Democratic presidential debate just days away, the newly released poll shows Hillary Clinton maintains a sizable lead over Sen. Bernie Sanders and Vice President Joe Biden, even though Biden hasnâ€™t officially jumped in the race. 
Clinton leads at 46 percent, Sanders has 27 percent and Biden has 16 percent. 
In the race for the GOP nomination, the CBS News poll reveals Donald Trump maintains the lead with 27 percent while Dr. Ben Carson closely trails behind with 21 percent. 
In the single digits, Sen. Ted Cruz has 9 percent, Sen. Marco Rubio follows with 8 percent, and former Gov. Jeb Bush and businesswoman Carly Fiorina both hold 6 percent. Gov. Mike Huckabee has slipped considerably from 8 percent in August to 2 percent in October. 
Speaker of the House John Boehner announced he will be leaving Congress at the end of the month, and new numbers show poor marks even from his own party. 
The CBS News poll shows 23 percent of both Republicans and Democrats approve of the job he is doing, while 52 percent disapprove. Twenty-four percent don't have an opinion, according to the poll. 
President Barack Obama's approval rating has been largely unchanged since January, and his overall job approval rating remains mixed: 45 percent of Americans approve of the job he is doing as president and 46 percent disapprove.
